title: 1950s Fashion Trends
description: How well do you remember the fashions that defined the fabulous fifties?

questions.question: What popular 1950s skirt style featured a wide, circular cut that flared out dramatically when twirling?
questions.explanation: The poodle skirt, a wide swing skirt often decorated with an appliqued poodle, became an iconic symbol of 1950s teenage fashion and sock hop culture.

questions.question: Which undergarment became essential in the 1950s to achieve the fashionable full-skirted silhouette?
questions.explanation: Crinoline petticoats, often made of stiffened nylon, were worn under full skirts to give them their signature volume and shape in the 1950s.

questions.question: What type of collar was commonly seen on men's shirts in the 1950s, often worn with the points buttoned down?
questions.explanation: The button-down collar, popularized by Brooks Brothers, became a staple of 1950s menswear, especially for the Ivy League preppy look.

questions.question: What style of women's shoes with a pointed toe and thin heel became wildly popular in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: Stiletto heels, named after the Italian stiletto dagger, first appeared in the early 1950s and became a must-have fashion accessory for women.

questions.question: Which type of men's jacket, inspired by Marlon Brando in 'The Wild One,' became a symbol of 1950s rebellion?
questions.explanation: The black leather motorcycle jacket became an icon of 1950s youth rebellion after Marlon Brando wore one in the 1953 film 'The Wild One.'

questions.question: What casual men's shirt style, featuring bold prints and a straight hem worn untucked, was popular in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: Hawaiian shirts (also called Aloha shirts) surged in popularity during the 1950s, especially after Hawaii became a tourist destination and a state in 1959.

questions.question: What feminine accessory was considered essential for a properly dressed woman in the 1950s when going out?
questions.explanation: In the 1950s, a well-dressed woman was expected to wear matching gloves and a hat when going out in public, whether shopping or attending church.

questions.question: Which fabric became widely available in the 1950s and revolutionized fashion with its easy-care, wrinkle-free properties?
questions.explanation: Polyester fabrics became widely available in the 1950s, marketed as miracle fabrics that were wrinkle-resistant, durable, and easy to care for.

questions.question: What style of men's pants, cut narrow at the ankle, was popular with the 'beatnik' crowd in the late 1950s?
questions.explanation: Stovepipe pants, with their narrow, straight legs, were favored by the beatnik subculture of the late 1950s, often worn in black.

questions.question: What type of sweater, worn backward with a decorative clasp at the back, was a 1950s fashion trend for women?
questions.explanation: Wearing a cardigan sweater backward, fastened with a decorative clasp at the neckline in back, was a popular 1950s trend for teenage girls.

questions.question: What popular 1950s casual shoe for men featured soft leather and a distinctive hand-sewn front seam?
questions.explanation: Penny loafers, with a leather strap across the front where teens slipped in a penny, were a staple of 1950s casual footwear for both men and women.

questions.question: Which designer is credited with creating the 'sack dress' in 1957, a loose-fitting shift that shocked the fashion world?
questions.explanation: Cristobal Balenciaga introduced the revolutionary 'sack dress' in 1957, a loose chemise style that moved away from the cinched-waist silhouette.

questions.question: What type of trousers, ending just below the knee, became a popular casual choice for women in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: Capri pants, also called pedal pushers when slightly longer, became fashionable in the 1950s, especially after Audrey Hepburn wore them in films.

questions.question: What men's hairstyle-related accessory was commonly sold alongside Brylcreem and other pomades in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: Pocket combs were essential accessories for 1950s men, carried in shirt or back pockets to maintain their carefully groomed pompadour and DA hairstyles.

questions.question: What coordinated women's knitwear ensemble, consisting of a matching pullover and cardigan, was a 1950s wardrobe staple?
questions.explanation: The twin set, a matching short-sleeved pullover sweater worn under a cardigan of the same color and fabric, was a quintessential 1950s ladylike look.
